intro: Jacquemontia tomentella var. tomentella, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a perennial vine native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green stems and heart-shaped, lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are typically followed by bean-like, hairy pods that contain several seeds. Jacquemontia tomentella var. tomentella is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, known for its climbing habit and ornamental value.
